litematica_printer.update.available: Litematica Printer update available! Current version: %s, Latest version: %s
litematica_printer.update.recommendation: It is strongly recommended to upgrade to the latest version to fix potential issues.
litematica_printer.update.failed: Failed to check for updates. Please try again later.
litematica_printer.config.comment.blockl:
You can enter a square or item ID, for example: §bminecraft:stone§r. 
If §b§r is preceded, a tag match will be used, and the list will match the corresponding squares according to the tag, for example: §llog§r. 
If you enter text and filter conditions (separated by commas), for example: §lstone, c§r. 
Where “c” means using the include matching method, you will try pinyin or directly match first.
litematica_printer.config.comment.autoTu: Automatically tune note blocks during printing.
litematica_printer.config.comment.safely: When enabled, it will first check if the block on the detection face of the observer is correct, and only place the block if it is correct.
litematica_printer.config.comment.printW: Place the ice and then destroy it to print the water.
litematica_printer.config.comment.iterat:
The order in which blocks are traversed during printing:
§dXYZ§r: First X, then Y, finally Z
§dXZY§r: First X, then Z, finally Y
§dYXZ§r: First Y, then X, finally Z
§dYZX§r: First Y, then Z, finally X
§dZXY§r: First Z, then X, finally Y
§dZYX§r: First Z, then Y, finally X
litematica_printer.config.comment.xRever: When enabled, X-axis traversal will be performed from high to low.
litematica_printer.config.comment.yRever:
When enabled, Y-axis traversal will be performed from high to low.
Destruction mode is reversed by default; enabling this will make it normal direction.
litematica_printer.config.comment.zRever: When enabled, Z-axis traversal will be performed from high to low.
litematica_printer.config.comment.fallin: When enabled, it will check if there is block support under falling blocks before placing them.
litematica_printer.config.comment.debugO: When enabled, printer working information is output in the console.
litematica_printer.config.comment.breakW:
When printing, if you touch a block that does not match the projection, it will destroy the block. 
With a new engine, it's powerful in efficiency and performance, but there may be some bugs.
litematica_printer.config.comment.breakE: When enabled, it will break any extra blocks that are not part of the projection during printing.
litematica_printer.config.comment.quickS:
If the server has the §bAxShulkers§r plugin installed, you can directly take items from shulker boxes in your inventory.
The replacement position is the preset position of Litematica, and if all preset positions have shulker boxes, it will not replace them.

§dClick Slot§r: Directly sends a right-click to open the shulker box in your inventory. (Requires plugin or mod support)
§dCall Method§r: Calls the mod function to directly open the shulker box.

The cooldown time (in ticks) for the quick shulker box feature. This prevents rapid opening of shulker boxes, which can cause server lag.
Set to 0 to disable cooldown.
litematica_printer.config.comment.printI:
The interval time (in ticks) during printing.
Set to 0 for no interval, which may cause server lag.
It is recommended to set it between 1-5 to balance performance and speed.
When the value is §b0§r, the option of §6§lBlocks per Tick§r will be provided, and you need to reopen the settings menu to see it.
litematica_printer.config.comment.printP:
The number of blocks printed per tick.
This option is enabled when the print interval is set to 0.
It is recommended to set it between 2-8 to balance performance and speed.
If set too high, you may be kicked from the server.
litematica_printer.config.comment.printS: When enabled, it will skip placing waterlogged blocks during printing.
